intro: Plagiobothrys tinctorius, commonly known as the redstem sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Plagiobothrys tinctorius is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
